title: Is it possible that in the future, humans meet another life form when space traveling? - Quora

response.answer_text: Is it possible that in the future, humans meet another life form when space traveling? The more we travel, the more likely it is to find either evidence or even contact with another intelligence. At the moment, contact is impossible unless they come to us, and the sheer size of the universe makes this unlikely unless they have a civilisation that covers major sections of the galaxy. We are separated not just by distance, but also time, thanks to the relativistic effects of the speed of light. There could be a thriving civilisation just 1% of the width of the Milky Way galaxy away from us, yet we will have no indication of their existence for a thousand years if they have just developed high technology.

It’s possible? Yes. Plausible? No. Probable? Definitely not. Possible is a pretty wide-open term. It is possible for all of the air in the room to suddenly concentrate in a sphere, leaving a vacuum everywhere else. While quantum mechanics predicts that strange things are possible, and do happen occasionally at the extremely small scale, they are exponentially less likely as we approach the scale of a room. If there is a 1:56 quintillion chance of something then that something is possible. But in science probability is key. Almost nothing is impossible, because impossibility is an absolute. But any number of wild ideas a wildly improbable. There is the famous example of a teapot in orbit around the Moon. It could be! But no one believes there is a teapot in orbit around the Moon.

It is not impossible so therefore it is possible. I think it’s very likely that microbes will be found on Mars if we send enough missions to look in a variety of places. I have always been a bit curious about Valles Marineris, a very deep gash in Mars that I think may be more conducive to lifeforms because of its greater atmospheric pressure and temperature. But I would not expect to find multicellular life there. Then there are various moons of Jupiter and Saturn for which there is good evidence of liquid water underneath a frozen shell. Those may be where the first true animate ET life-forms are found. And the cool thing is these are in our backyard. We just need to summon the will and resources to send the missions. As for technologically developed ETs, they are probably not to be found in the Solar System but again, it is not impossible.

Possible sure… the term lifeform is a relative term. That means it can be any thing that is living and can reproduce. Bacteria is a life form so small we may not see it… we have already found what may be a such form chemistry on Mars we think might… But, not sure certain, I believe the case. In our universe known we think all life is fundamentally CARBON base atom in form chains… but, there could be SILICON based … OR other wise? Earth us but a tiny, very tiny, hardly a speck of dust in just our own galaxy in a Universe of potentially billions or more galaxy. If we could go at the speed of light of 186, 000 feet per second+ it would take a hundred thousand light years just to go end to end our spiral galaxy length sides. And, maybe, just MAYBE we might bump into a life form chemistry like ours, or be other wise. There doesn't HAVE TO BE another but we human things are made of curiosity to play with the Theory of Probability to not be bored with nothing to imagine to give us a reason to exist.

I want to help NASA create robots and space ships for space exploration and planting life everywhere where possible. The ships would be flying for millions of years through the galaxy (galaxies)and would be artificially superintelligent. To put humans on the ships would be limiting of the missions goals. Human would eventually travel later, after the artificial intelligence does necessary pre-research. Maybe that is how life came to Earth, or how human life came to Earth. In me you have the first human who declared himself to have reached human superintelligence. The future will open endless possibilities, from uploading of human minds onto computers (I have a idea how it could work, of course), to world peace and the world government. Read my other answers, have fun, follow me on Quora, thanks. My first book is about to be published, in the few days it is in “United PC publishing” online store and somewhat later it should come on Amazon. The book title:” Bipolar freak story”. Good luck to you.

OK, We humans are traveling in space and meet another life form. That means that the other life form is also traveling in space and was intelligent enough to get there. Can we say the Alien is as smart as we are? By the way, this is impossible. We humans are the only intelligent beings in the Milky Way Galaxy. The next intelligent beings live a million galaxies away and much too far to travel to get here right by us. Too far makes it impossible. If they were close by we would be looking at them today -

Intelligent lifeforms? NO. The Fermi Paradox and the inverse square law rule out contact with intelligent lifeforms, though Drake’s equation predicts their existence is statistically certain. Simple life, like single cell organisms? More likely. Keep an eye on missions to Europa, providing Trump doesn’t use the money to build another monument to himself.

Extremely improbable. Travel to the stars is limited by the speed of light. Even if you could violate the laws of physics (and you can’t), the odds of meeting up with someone randomly in the vastness of space is, well, astronomical! To say otherwise, would be an indication of lack of understanding of the circumstances.

Fact A: we are here, we evolved, no one interfered with us. As we expand our capacity in the cosmos there will likely be fact B: All intelligent species we interact with are inferior or nearly equal to us. This provides Inference C: Superior races do not exist. Or Superior races are uniformly avoiding us.

Yes we didn't know, that there were any other planets in other solar systems in the universe until recently. Obviously they were there, even if we didn't know that they were there. We did believe that we were at the center of the universe, but this was incorrect also. To believe that we are the only type of life in the universe, is just like believing, that we are still at the center of the universe.
Might have already happened. It would be deemed classified if it had.
